title: Someone’s recreated the entire Friends Central Perk set out of Lego
text:
Honestly, how great is this life-size Lego Friends set? (Picture: NBC; Nathan Sawaya/Warner Bros. TV)

An artist and super Friends fan has created a life-size version of the Central Perk set out of 1million Lego pieces and we stan.

Nathan Sawaya, aka The Brick Artist, spent four months building the fully-functioning iconic hangout spot in celebration of the sitcom’s 25th anniversary and people can visit it in Las Vegas.

The impressive model includes Phoebe Buffay’s guitar as well as a Lego cash register, coffee jug and all of the containers that can be spotted lurking around the bar area.

‘Basically, I started by watching a lot of Friends,’ Nathan explained.

‘I had been a fan for years, but I started streaming again to get a sense of how much is actually in Central Perk.

‘We knew the 25th anniversary was going to be big, and I think there’s so much detail in that shop that the audience never even saw.’

Nathan Sawaya is a genius (Picture: Nathan Sawaya/Warner Bros. TV)

He continued to People: ‘We wanted to do this faithfully, so we spent a lot of time working on a lot of little elements.

‘We wanted to make sure it was all there.’

Last month, Lego brought out a Friends collection of Central Perk, which is *a lot* smaller than Nathan’s impressive version.

Look at the cash register! (Picture: Nathan Sawaya/Warner Bros. TV)

The set comprises of 1070 pieces, including minifigures of Ross Geller, Chandler Bing, Rachel Green, Monica Geller, Joey Tribbiani, Phoebe Buffay and Gunther.

Actress Jennifer Garner filmed herself lovingly recreate the classic quiz scene from Friends using her Lego by way of welcoming Jennifer Aniston to Instagram yesterday.

Mimicking the laugh-out-loud moments that were captured in the season four episode The One With The Embryos, Jennifer used her figures to reenact Rachel and Monica going head to head with Chandler and Joey for the prize of Monica’s apartment.

The star even provided the voices for the characters herself, and didn’t even let a small slip up like the Lego piece’s hair falling off get in the way of her performance.
